question: 右手
sourceMnemonic: Your <kanji>right</kanji> <kanji>hand</kanji> is your <vocabulary>right hand</vocabulary>! This word can also be used to mean <vocabulary>right arm</vocabulary>, and <vocabulary>right-hand side</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. This word, however, uses the kun'yomi readings. This is possibly because of <ja>手</ja>, because body parts often use kun'yomi. You learned both readings with the individual words, so you should be able to read this.
